The coronavirus knows no boundaries, and we cannot allow a slow federal response to leave our smaller municipalities and local governments behind.

The CARES Act authorized more than $150 billion to help meet the needs of states and local governments on the frontlines of the crisis but the legislation relies on our states to distribute the funding to smaller units of local government.

Our state leaders urgently need communication, clarity, and guidance from Treasury to effectively plan and inform our localities of the help that is in the pipeline. 
https://t.co/Sp9ArRx7OE

The lack of leadership from this Administration has created chaos with states in bidding wars against each other and FEMA for critical personal protective equipment and ventilators.

What we need now is a non-political supply chain czar to stop the harmful bidding war competition between states and instead get us working together as one great nation to get this equipment where it‚Äôs needed.

We‚Äôre facing shortages of ventilators & PPE because this Administration failed to take the threat seriously and prepare. Had President Trump and VP Pence focused on our health care needs rather than politics this winter, we‚Äôd be ordering fewer body bags this spring. https://t.co/YisTPTNaEE
